event.title: is located southwest of Augusta on the Ogeechee River, and its population was 2,712 at the 2000

data.event: It is located southwest of Augusta on the Ogeechee River, and its population was 2,712 at the 2000 census.
Louisville was laid out in 1786 as the prospective state capital.
Development of the city began later, and its state government buildings were completed in 1795.
The Jefferson County courthouse, built in 1904, stands on the site of Georgia's first permanent capitol building.
